reviews.review_msg: I have taken SA 363, 358, and now 345 all online, and I feel that 345 is the easiest and most interesting of the 3. The course is composed of 2 short papers, an essay, and a final, and as such, there are very few assignments to worry about. Most weeks require little to no work. Readings are difficult, and are not explained, but are interesting.

This class discusses many current and interesting topics. Professor Dossa possesses a lot of knowledge about these topics and she teaches with enthusiasm. She encourages students to voice their opinions and to actively participate in class. This class consists of mandatory seminars, group presentations, papers and weekly readings.
Is sweet, but is a poor teacher. Prepared to be bored out of your mind, I was.

Parin was very disorganized. The syllabus was often wrong. She did however revise due dates because of this. She is a tough marker but doesn't give good feedback as to why she assigned that grade. I often received a lower grade than I thought I would and with only "GOOD" as feedback.

Be prepared for backhanded compliments if you don't do the work or present the material during class without your best foot forward. Parin is very passionate about the topics that she covers but they are so similar just feels repetitive themes As a guy, Its hard to get invested in the course when it covers mostly female POV, emotions are felt :(

Fantastic class, Parin is genuinly interested in what she teaches. She is inspirational and help you to be a critical thinker. there is a lot of group works for her classes and particpation really matters for this class.
One of my favourite profs at SFU, wonderful course content and literature. Learned a lot. Thanks Parin!
Great Professor! Not a difficult course if take with her. Lots of group presentations.

Parin is a wonderful professor full of insight which challenges the way many things, such as "race" are constructed. I was recommended her by a friend who I was losing hope in finding a good prof at SFU. Lots of group work, lots of (interesting) reading, lots of discussion. I plan to take more courses with her in the future.

Lots of group work that seemed aimless, with very little actual instruction on the course topics. Criteria varied considerably between the prof and the TM, which made constructive feedback hard to find.

Parin is a wonderful professor. She shows genuine insight and is dedicated to make the material mean something to you. If you do the readings, show up, talk in class and can write decent you will get an A.. She is always available for help as well. I would recommend taking a class with her.

Took by distance learning. Material is kind of boring and slanted. If you stick to the script and write your papers accordingly then you'll do fine. The final exam was only 2 straightforward questions but you will end up writing a lot but it will pay off.

i have no comments about parin, i am taking an online course with her. the TA amie maclean is straight out of hell. she marks so hard and makes stupid remarks on assignments, without explaining her unhelpful comments. never take a class esp with that TA.

NO EXAMS, you have to attend each class to get participation marks, about 3 papers and marks reasonably, a lot of reading which you use for you papers, but she doesn't check if you have read it all. Watch alot of movies, so easy going class, not that stressful, have fun..she is helpful and nice.
Amazing prof, lovs to teach, very passionate about her work. I highly recommend her, she'll teach you a lot.

She really loves what she teaches, and is incredibly knowledgable and perceptive. The group work can get tedious, but I think she is just trying to teach creatively. If you're interested in the course material, you will love the class.

She requires group work but what this class does is prepare you for the real world-where you might even have to work with other (!) Her biases are apparent but that is why students who enjoy actually engaging with interesting material and don't mind dialogue should enrol..you grade will fairly reflect your effort.
She has no idea

She has all good intentions and truly loves what she teaches.  However, her teaching style doesn't seem to be polished.  She assigns a lot of group work and has NO EXAMS.( good stuff) I did not read the texts and bluffed my book review, as well as forgot to hand in references on my paper and still got a B.
This class is as exciting as watching paint dry. Parin likes to spend a lot of time on pointless group work. Her assignment guidelines and instructions are unclear. I hated this class with a passion.
easy marker if you put effort into your work. lecs are quite boring and repetitive. has good intentions, but teaching style isn't very helpful.

Uses group work as a reason not to teach. Assignments are generally meaningless but nonetheless extremely time consuming. Ushamedly plays favourites. Spineless students sit back while she pours out her disdain on the evil colonialists who pay her salary. A really sad person. Avoid.

This woman makes group work something to dread.  There's so much of it that you wonder if there's a point doing the readings or taking notes.  Gives great insights to assist in your assignment but otherwise you're left thinking the course doesn't do much for you.  Otherwise, she tries.

As others have noted, she does seem to have good intentions and is excited about teaching, but sadly, she is very very bad at it. Lots of useless group work. Lots of small assignments and "field projects" that require work and dont really have a point. Large assignment ok but lectures are painful!!!
Good professor!  Cares about what she teaches.  She encourages participation and teaches critical thinking.

wow, at first, i thought she was very intelligent and looked forward  to the class, as it went on it was obvious she played favorites. She shh'd people, was rude, callous, and seemed to mark on a emotional whim.Tho, her recent book is brilliant, avoid her
expect to do tons of group work, her directions are often vague, but an easy enough class. some interesting discussions
A little unclear on assignments (ie. journaling) and too much group work!
I think her intentions are really good, but the way in which she goes about organizing the class can be very frustrating and unproductive.

She can't teach worth ****! She pawns all the teaching off onto students, "collaborative learning" my ass! Too much work for what she gives back, which is nothing. Avoid unless you want to work your ass off to fail!
Her idea of "teaching" is based on reading her notes to the class with overheads of "key terms". We expect much more from an upper level course. Completely non-interactive. Boring as hell.
No Comments
A bit of a space cadet.  Nice enough lady, though.
brilliant course.   makes theory comprehensible.
No Comments
huh...i don't understand anything she says
No Comments
